resource.chars:
<u>one side of the cerebral hemispheres, in 
the anterior third, cross in the corpus callosum,
and ultimately reach the opposite inner & outer capsules.<\u>
Where do they go to afterwards?
[of those entering the inner capsule a few bundles,
only a very few, appear to end in the bend 
of the caudate nucleus. The caudate nucleus 
of Thom[?], however, has particularly few fibres 
connected with it, & it is only a few things in 
its head wh: apparently find their attachment 
here out of the enormous mass composing 
the anterior half <s>extremity <\s> of the inner capsule. By 
far the greater number of the <s>se<\s> fibres of the 
inner capsule derived from the frontal lobe 
do not terminate here, but are conducted back-
wards to the thalamus opticus, & enter it <s>nearly 
about <\s> opposite in or near the <u>knee <\u> of the inner capsule. One large 
leash of these is as before mentioned the 
anterior peduncle of the thalamus. It runs 
directly backwards in the substance of 
the inner capsule & becomes entirely connected 
with the thalamus.
[of those entering the outer capsule a little 
further explanation will be necessary. The 
outer capsule throughout the greater part of
